oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Orthogonal selectivity with cinnamic acids in 3-substituted benzofuran synthesis through C-H olefination of phenols
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: AGASTI, S
SHARMA, U
NAVEEN, T
MAITI, D
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: UNACTIVATED INTERNAL ALKYNES
MARINE SPONGE
OXIDATIVE ANNULATION
CARBOXYLIC-ACIDS
ARYL CHLORIDES
HECK REACTIONS
OXIME ESTERS
IANTHELLA SP
O-ARYLATION
INHIBITORS
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A palladium catalyzed intermolecular annulation of cinnamic acids and phenols has been achieved for the selective synthesis of 3-substituted benzofurans. Isotope labeling, competition experiments, kinetic studies, and intermediate trapping have supported a sequence of C-C bond formation and decarboxylation followed by the C-O cyclization pathway.
